ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: -it is a required course for MCDB PhD students to practice giving talks and giving feedback on others' talks

It's your chance to hear about everyone's research, and learn who does what techniques if you ever need to do them in the future. I'd recommend it even if it wasn't mandatory, because it's useful for everyone's research.
Yes (mandatory), but a good speaking& listening experience.
MCDB902 is a great opportunity to practice presentation skills. I would encourage all graduate students and post-docs to participate.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: -the course has greatly improved my presentation skills and the research questions I have been addressing to move my project forward

It's shown me how other people think and talk about their research, especially in the context of their model system. I think this is particularly helpful because when we're in our fields, we tend to get somewhat myopic and lose the ability to communicate our research to a broader audience. This class teaches us to do that while at the same time showing us other people's research.
Improved my speaking ability and gave me practice asking questions.
